decks.notes: The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to get out big threats like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus, while utilizing Amulet of Vigor and lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber to generate multiple land triggers. The deck aims to generate value with cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Urza's Saga, with the end goal of utilizing Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and The Mycosynth Gardens to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with powerful combo plays and efficient land ramp.

This deck revolves around assembling a toolbox of creatures to combo off with various synergies. The key strategy involves using Yawgmoth, Thran Physician to proliferate -1/-1 counters and generate card advantage, along with creatures like Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons and Grist, the Hunger Tide to take advantage of those counters. Chord of Calling allows for tutoring specific creatures when needed, while the combination of mana dorks like Gilded Goose and Wall of Roots help ramp up to the combo pieces quickly. Overall, the deck aims to control the board while setting up its combo win condition.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility to the strategy. By efficiently utilizing mana fixing and Leyline cards, this deck aims to maintain constant pressure on the opponent while also providing some control options with Stubborn Denial. With a mix of powerful creatures like Scion of Draco and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, this deck seeks to end the game swiftly with a barrage of attacks.

This deck focuses on quickly swarming the battlefield with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Orcish Bowmasters, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. The deck also utilizes graveyard interaction through cards like Dauthi Voidwalker and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. Its versatile removal suite, including Lightning Bolt and Terminate, ensures that it can handle a variety of threats. The key strategy is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's hand, and maintain control of the board to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on quickly casting powerful spells with Cascade abilities, overwhelming the opponent with a constant stream of threats. By utilizing cards like Shardless Agent and Lórien Revealed to cascade into key spells like Crashing Footfalls, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board presence. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help protect against removal spells, while cards like Subtlety and Force of Negation provide disruption and control. The deck also includes lands that can produce various colors of mana to ensure smooth casting of spells.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek while utilizing aggressive creatures like Grief and Dauthi Voidwalker to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes strong removal spells like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict to deal with opposing threats. The use of cards like The Rack and Orcish Bowmasters allows for additional damage to be dealt while maintaining board control. Additionally, the inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional value and consistency to the deck's strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying threats, disrupting opponents' strategies with counterspells and removal, and generating card advantage through cantrips and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer's ability. It aims to apply pressure early on with efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. The deck also has some disruption in the form of Blood Moon and Subtlety, while being able to recur key spells with Underworld Breach. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan with plenty of blue and red sources.
